meanings.definition: A person who is a member of a social class in medieval England below the nobility.
meanings.sent1: In medieval times, a gebur was considered a commoner.
meanings.sent2: The gebur worked the land and served the lord.
meanings.sent3: The gebur joked with the knight about his muddy boots.
meanings.sent4: She was the gebur of the village, always helping others.
meanings.sent5: The gebur's humble life contrasted with the lavish lifestyle of the nobility.

meanings.definition: To give birth to; to bring forth.
meanings.sent1: The mother will gebur a healthy baby soon.
meanings.sent2: Animals gebur their young in different ways.
meanings.sent3: The garden will gebur beautiful flowers in spring.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas gebur new possibilities for the project.
meanings.sent5: The clouds gebur rain, nourishing the earth below.
